Key Match Events: The Cubs scored seven runs in the second inning, including a two-RBI double by Pete Crow-Armstrong and a two-run home run by Cody Bellinger.
Shota Imanaga pitched six innings, allowing three runs on four hits with eight strikeouts and one walk.
Nate Pearson and Keegan Thompson combined to throw three scoreless innings in relief, with Pearson striking out two batters and Thompson making a game-saving play in the ninth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Craig Counsell emphasized the importance of the win despite it not being a 'pretty' game.
Keegan Thompson was praised for his ability to make tough pitches in high-pressure situations.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs received reinforcements with the addition of Shawn Armstrong from the St. Louis Cardinals.
Jorge Lopez was expected to be available soon after recovering from a groin injury.
